metadata.Title: CVE-2016-2106 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - low.
metadata.Description:
Integer overflow in the EVP_EncryptUpdate function in crypto/evp/evp_enc.c in OpenSSL before 1.0.1t and 1.0.2 before 1.0.2h allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (heap memory corruption) via a large amount of data.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-2106` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libssl1.0.0 - 1.0.1f-1ubuntu2.19
openssl - 1.0.1f-1ubuntu2.19
No subscription required

criterions.comment: openssl package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.0.1f-1ubuntu2.19').
openssl098: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
